thread.title: 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight
thread.title_full: 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight

title: 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight Seven high school football players have been suspended from games after they were involved in a fight last week. Post to Facebook 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight Seven high school football players have been suspended from games after they were involved in a fight last week. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 7 Manatee, Sarasota players suspended after game fight 10 News Staff, WTSP 5:28 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 The players got into a fight last Friday night during a game between Braden River and North Port high schools (Photo: Manatee schools) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Bradenton, Florida -- Seven high school football players have been suspended from games after they were involved in a fight last week. 
The players got into a fight last Friday night during a game between Braden River and North Port high schools. The players -- two from Braden River and five from North Port -- are suspended for at least four weeks and will face additional school-based disciplinary measures including community service. 
Both the Manatee and Sarasota school districts reviewed reports of the incident. A joint report and disciplinary actions will be forwarded to the Florida High School Athletic Association. 
“The confrontation that took place following the game last Friday is unacceptable based on the standards both counties have set for our student athletes,” said Manatee Supervisor of Athletics Jason Montgomery and Sarasota Supervisor of Athletics Bethany D. King. “In addition to disciplinary measures involving our student athletes, this incident has caused both counties to take a close look at how we handle game procedures both home and away to make sure this kind of incident does not occur again.” Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1RwFrov TOP VIDEOS
